@Sushobhan04
torch.zeros(a.size()) is not using the same storage as a itslef (cpu/ device #).
I am using this workaround:
a.new(a.size()).zero_()
Or when needing a different tensor type, say long, this one:
a.new().long().new(a.size()).zero_()
This is kind of a strange way to create tensors, not suggested by docs, but actually quite convenient
